Package org.zaproxy.zap.scan

Class BaseScannerThread<StartOptions extends ScanStartOptions>

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
org.zaproxy.zap.scan.BaseScannerThread<StartOptions>
Type Parameters:
StartOptions - the type of the start scan options
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseContextScannerThread
public abstract class BaseScannerThread<StartOptions extends ScanStartOptions> extends Thread
The base implementation that needs to be extended for a thread that is used to run a Scan.

This abstract implementation handles common elements that correspond to all scans (scan progress, scan maximum progress, running/paused state, start options), but should be extended to take into consideration particular needs of the scan.

An important characteristic of the scanner threads is that they are based on a set of start options (ScanStartOptions) that should be used for fully specifying the configuration for a particular scan. The scan options should be provided to the Scanner Thread before being started via the setStartOptions(ScanStartOptions) method. Examples of configuration required might include: context and/or site node to scan, user to scan as, policy etc.

The most important method that needs to be implemented is scan(), but other common methods should be implemented as well, calling the super implementation:

  • pauseScan()
  • resumeScan()
  • startScan()
  • stopScan()
See Also:
  • ScanStartOptions
  • ScannerThreadManager

      public void setPaused(boolean paused)
      Sets the paused state of the thread and, if the thread needs to be resumed and was paused and sleeping, it gets signaled.
      Parameters:
      paused - whether the thread should be paused or not
      See Also:
      • checkPausedAndWait()

    • checkPausedAndWait

      protected void checkPausedAndWait()
      Checks whether the scan is paused and, if it is, sleeps until it's resumed. Internally, this method makes use of threading synchronization features (ReentrantLock and Condition) to cause the calling thread to wait, if needed. Thus, it is mandatory to eventually call setPaused(false) from another thread to wake the calling thread.
      See Also:
      • setPaused(boolean)

    • setRunningState

      public void setRunningState(boolean running)
      Sets the running state of the thread.
      Parameters:
      running - whether the thread is running or not

    • hasRun

      public boolean hasRun()
      Checks if the scanner thread has already run/been started. Useful as a Java Thread cannot be restarted.
      Returns:
      true, if successful

    • run

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • pauseScan

      public void pauseScan()
      Method called when the scan is paused. The base implementation handles the update of the thread's paused state, but should be overridden if necessary.

      Note: Implementations must be careful to make sure the scan actually gets paused (either by overriding this method or by constantly checking the isPaused() status or using the checkPausedAndWait() method in the scan() method).

      Note: This method is not always run on the scanner thread.

      See Also:
      • setPaused(boolean)

    • resumeScan

      public void resumeScan()
      Method called when the scan is resumed. The base implementation handles the update of the thread's paused state, but should be overridden if necessary.

      Note: Implementations must be careful to make sure the scan actually gets paused (either by overriding this method or by constantly checking the isPaused() status or using the checkPausedAndWait() method in the scan() method).

      Note: This method is not always run on the scanner thread.

      See Also:
      • setPaused(boolean)

    • stopScan

      public void stopScan()
      Method called when the scan is stopped before it finished. The base implementation handles the update of the thread's running state, but should be overridden if necessary. If the thread is now stopped, also updates the paused state to false, to make sure that, if the thread was sleeping, it gets awakened.

      Note: Implementations must be careful to make sure the scan is stopped and the thread finishes (either by overriding this method or by constantly checking the isRunning() status in the scan() method).

      Note: This method is not always run on the scanner thread.

    • startScan

      public void startScan()
      Method called when the scan is started. The base implementation handles the update of the thread's running state and calls the scan() method.

      Note: This method is being run on the scanner thread.

    • start

      public void start()
      Overrides:
      start in class Thread

    • scan

      protected abstract void scan()
      Method called on the scanner thread in order to perform the work required by the scan.
